newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish Nationale Nederlanden turns to profit in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Polish Nationale Nederlanden turns to profit in Q1.

text.p: Polish life insurance company Nationale Nederlanden showed a three million zloty net profit in the first quarter of 1997, after a three million zloty loss in the same period in 1996, the firm said in a statement.
The company said in the first quarter its gross premiums grew to 34 million zlotys from seven million zlotys. It said its investments rose to 48 million zlotys from eight million last year.
Nationale Nederlanden, a fully owned Polish subsidiary of ING Continental Europe BV said it had two percent of Polish life insurance market in 1996.
